page.title: 19Transport
page.content: In Southowram,people use buses for going shopping and getting to work. There are a lot of cars using the main road after breakfast, and before tea when people are travelling to and from work.In the daytime there are fewer cars except at the end of school,when some children get lifts home.On the main road there are delivery vans bringing things to the shops in the day and some heavy lorries bringing loads fron the brick works and concrete divisions of Marshall's. Sometimes lorries bring food to the school canteen kitchen and the dustbin lorry takes away rubbish once a week. The milkman brings bottles of milk for the infants every day.There are also post-office,telephone,electricity and gas vans passing through the village. Once a week a car comes from the education department bringing letters.
